definition: coin/money/CL:筆|笔[bi3]/unit of weight, one tenth of a tael 兩|两[liang3]
Taiwan pr. used in 夾生|夹生[jia1 sheng1] and 夾竹桃|夹竹桃[jia1 zhu2 tao2]
to press from either side/to place in between/to sandwich/to carry sth under armpit/wedged between/between/to intersperse/to mix/to mingle/clip/folder/Taiwan pr. [jia2]

sentences.english: She pulled a lipstick and a mirror from her purse.
sentences.chinese: 簡尼特蓋好打字機，從錢夾裏拿出口紅和鏡子。

sentences.english: Make a copy of the list and put it in your purse or wallet.
sentences.chinese: 將該該清單複製一份放在您的口袋或錢夾裏。

sentences.english: I told her about finding the wallet and showed her the letter.
sentences.chinese: 我告訴她關於拾到錢夾的事並給她看了信。

sentences.english: Try a front-pocket wallet or money clip.
sentences.chinese: 試着用上衣袋的錢包或者錢夾。

sentences.english: It was so dark(that) I couldn't find my wallet on the floor.
sentences.chinese: 天太黑了，我沒能發現地上的錢夾。

sentences.english: My sister has a little purse made of soft leather .
sentences.chinese: 我妹妹有一個小巧的軟皮錢夾。

sentences.english: Janet covered her typewriter. She pulled a lipstick and a mirror from her purse.
sentences.chinese: 簡尼特蓋好打字機，從錢夾裏拿出口紅和鏡子。

definition: to return something to its rightful owner
lit. neither a relative nor a friend (idiom)/fig. unrelated to one another in any way
half a life/only half alive/barely alive/(scared, beaten etc) half to death
please excuse me for not complying/to politely decline
lit. firing after the horse/fig. belated action/giving advice in hindsight
